content: What iconic American fast-food chain was founded by brothers Richard and Maurice McDonald in 1940 and later expanded by Ray Kroc?

That would be McDonald's, one of the most recognized fast-food chains globally. It started as a barbecue restaurant in San Bernardino, California, but later transitioned to a hamburger stand with a focus on speed and efficiency, which became the foundation of the fast-food model. Ray Kroc joined the company in 1955 as a franchise agent and rapidly expanded it into the multinational corporation it is today.
